definition: to examine/to cast a critical eye over (especially in the context of introspection)
to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department
short name for Chahar Province 察哈爾|察哈尔[Cha2 ha1 er3]
to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident

sentences.english: The examination of conscience begins with this letter writing.
sentences.chinese: 良心的省察開始於這種信件寫作。

sentences.english: The mind-searching period should be short, a minute at most.
sentences.chinese: 省察內心的時間要短，最多不要超過一分鐘。

sentences.english: Sometimes if we analyze and examine our own negativity it does nothing to reduce it.
sentences.chinese: 剖析和省察我們的消極性有時候並不能降低其程度。

sentences.english: That is exactly the Senecan style of self-examination.
sentences.chinese: 這確實是西尼卡自我省察的方式。

sentences.english: My mind needs a guard to keep out anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 我需要省察我的心不被焦慮所困。

sentences.english: My mind needs a guard from temptation.
sentences.chinese: 我需要省察我的心不致陷入試探。

sentences.english: My mind needs a guard from suspicion.
sentences.chinese: 我需要省察我的心不隨便對人起疑心。

sentences.english: It is a kind of permanent self-examination.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種永久的自我省察。

definition: to maintain/to adhere to/to observe (an injunction etc)
to examine oneself/to reflect on one's shortcomings/introspection/self-awareness/self-criticism
silent contemplation/to meditate/to think in silence
the will of Heaven/the will of God
